thread.title: Comment on Introducing Walker Wood by BenHur
thread.title_full: Comment on Introducing Walker Wood by BenHur

author: BenHur
title: Comment on Introducing Walker Wood by BenHur
text:
Posted in FB Recruiting , Football , Main | 1 Response Walker Wood (Scout.com) 
Before the madness that was Thursday Night Football, Kentucky received a 2016 commitment from Lafayette Quarterback Walker Wood. Rated as a three-star dual threat across the board, Wood signed as an athlete and could fit into a number of roles at UK. Let‚Äôs break down the new recruit. (Click on the blue links to watch highlights of Wood courtesy of Hudl.com) So happy to say that I've committed to the University of Kentucky! So blessed to have the best people in my lifeüîµ‚ö™Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/KDoDf8vn2C 
‚Äî Walker Wood (@Wood7Walker) October 15, 2015 
Wood is extremely versatile. Lafayette uses him on the ground as much as they do in the air. Wood has the footwork and agility to run the read option with ease at the 6A level. I watched him in person for the first time against Scott County . He showed great touch on his passes and threw the deep ball very well. He is protected by two of the top offensive lineman (Landon Young and JeDrick Wills) and has Wofford-commit Mason Alstatt in the backfield. Even with all these studs on his team, Wood still was the player who stood out to me the most. Wood is extremely mobile and can make great plays on the run (once again, watch the Hudl tape). He is signed on to be an athlete, meaning he could play a variety of positions when he comes on campus. 
Wood said he would like to compete for the quarterback position. He will battle against Drew Barker, Gunner Hoak, and Mac Jones in the next couple years. He definitely has the intangibles to compete for the spot. 
Look for this post to be updated throughout the day. 
Article written by Trey Huntsman Keepin' fresh since '96. Covering baseball and football while studying on occasion. Follow me on Twitter @TreyHuntsmanKSR. One response to ‚ÄúIntroducing Walker Wood‚Äù BenHur October 17, 2015 at 6:10 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Height and weight seems relevant. Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
